values: 4D NUCLEOME DATA COORDINATION AND INTEGRATION CENTER

fieldDescription: A very short display label for this contact's DCC
A human-readable description of this DCC

values: The 4D Nucleome (4DN) Data Coordination and Integration Center (DCIC) aims to collect, store, curate, display, and analyze data generated in the 4DN Network. The DCIC is a collaboration of two centers from three institutions: Harvard University, Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), and The Washington University in St. Louis (WashU). The Harvard/MIT DCIC is tasked with building the infrastructure for data collection and integration. The Harvard/MIT and WashU centers will collaborate on the development and incorporation of novel data visualization tools. The 4DN Data Portal is accessible at data.4dnucleome.org.

fieldDescription: An EDAM CV format term
A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this EDAM format term
A human-readable description of this EDAM format term

values: FASTQ short read format ignoring quality scores.

BAM format, the binary, BGZF-formatted compressed version of SAM format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
Browser Extensible Data (BED) format of sequence annotation track, typically to be displayed in a genome browser.
bigBed format for large sequence annotation tracks, similar to textual BED format.
bigWig format for large sequence annotation tracks that consist of a value for each sequence position. Similar to textual WIG format.
Tabular data represented as tab-separated values in a text file.
The bedGraph format allows display of continuous-valued data in track format. This display type is useful for probability scores and transcriptome data
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing data, based on Hierarchical Data Format (HDF).
Image file format used by the Open Microscopy Environment (OME).
Tabular data represented as comma-separated values in a text file.
TAR archive file format generated by the Unix-based utility tar.
ZIP is an archive file format that supports lossless data compression.

fieldDescription: A list of synonyms for this term as identified by the EDAM metadata
An EDAM CV data term
A short, human-readable, machine-read-friendly label for this EDAM data term
A human-readable description of this EDAM data term

values: A nucleic acid sequence and associated metadata.
Data (typically biological or biomedical) that has been rendered into an image, typically for display on screen.
Annotation of one particular positional feature on a biomolecular (typically genome) sequence, suitable for import and display in a genome browser.

fieldDescription: A list of synonyms for this term as identified by the EDAM metadata

values: ['Sequence alignment (nucleic acid)', 'RNA sequence alignment', 'DNA sequence alignment']

['Genome-browser track', 'Genome annotation track', 'Genomic track', 'Genome track', 'Sequence annotation track']

The size of this file in bytes
The total decompressed size in bytes of the contents of this file: null if this file is not compressed
(preferred) SHA-256 checksum for this file [sha256, md5 cannot both be null]

If this file is a bundle encoding more than one sub-file, this field gives the local_id of a collection listing the bundle's sub-file contents; null otherwise
